div.l: Tyll we be roten kan̄ we not be rype
We hoppen̄ alwey · while the world wol pype
For in oure wylle ther stykketh neủer avayle
To haue a hore here and a grene tayle
As hath a leke for though oure myght be gone
Oure wylle desyreth eủer in one
For when̄ we may nought don̄ then̄ woll we speke
Yette in oure asshen̄ old ys fyre y reke
Foure gledes haue we which y schall devyse
Auauntynge lyeng anger Couetyse
These iiij sparcles longen vn to elde
Our͗e old lym̄es now wol be vnweld
But wylle ne schall fayle us that is soth
And yette haue y alwey a coltes toth
And many a yere as hit ys passed henne
Syth that my tappe of lyf bygan̄ to renne
The streme of lyf droppeth now on the chymbe
The sely tong may well rynge and chymbe
Of wrechednesse that passed ys full yore
With old folk save dotage ys no more
¶ Oure oste
seid
what deuel made þe Reve to p̉reche
Of a Souter a Schipman̄ or a leche
Sey forth thi tale and tarye not þe tyme
Lo dartford and hit ys almost pⁱrime
Now ʆsires quoth this Oswold þe Reve
I pᵃray you at my tale nought greve
This dronken̄ Myller hath told us her͗e
How that Bygyled was a Carpenter͗e
ꝐParauenture in skorne for y am one
And by youre leve y schal quyte hȳm anon̄e
Right in his churlyssch termes wol y speke
I byseche god mot his nek breke
He kan̄ well in myn̄ yȝe see a stalke
But in his own̄ he kan̄ not see a balke
